ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was
What is your overall assessment of this course
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I advanced my knowledge of Spanish in speaking, writing, and reading.
I strengthened my knowledge of previous Spanish grammar skills taught in L2 and supplemented this knowledge with additional cultural readings and media.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think this course and well organized and I don't have any suggestions for improvements.

The course is organized in a way that really helps improve the level of spanish of the students quickly. However, I found that some of the readings in this course were way above our level and often had specialized vocabulary so that I would have to look up many words.

I thoroughly enjoyed the readings and videos that brightened up the class. The professors were really helpful with accommodating questions about tricky grammatical concepts that were difficult for the students.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, this course is nicely structured to facilitate Spanish language learning. If you're interested in learning the language, this is the best way to do it.

Yes. If you feel a bit fuzzy on past grammar structures or concepts or just simply want to expand your Spanish vocabulary, it's a helpful course to take. Be warned, however, that the class moves rapidlyyou need to be on top of yourself and hold yourself accountable.
